results.title: The Time of your life
results.brief_description: Record numbers of Australians are living longer. The increase in the numbers of elderly people poses problems with the provision of suitable community services including health and accommodation. At the same time society can discriminate against people as they age, depriving them of companionship, dignity and fulfilment. Indeed there is no reason why they should not pass the Century mark, leading full and active lives. Written and narrated by David Goldie.

results.title: The Time of the monster
results.brief_description: An outline of social and political world events in 1933, emphasising the rise to power of Adolf Hitler and his National Socialist Party. Uses newsreel footage from the Associated British Pathe Library.

results.title: The Tim Winton interviews
results.brief_description: Divided into two segments, Tim Winton discusses the work he produces for adult audiences, as typified by his book “Cloudstreet” and the work he produces for a teenage audience as typified by the “Lochie Leonard” books. He discusses his work, his lifestyle, his background and his inspiration.

He discusses his work, his lifestyle, his background and his inspiration.

results.title: The Tightrope
results.brief_description: This film documents four stories - three about girls leaving school (Daniella who wants to become a model and an actress; Karen who is already engaged and planning to be a wife; and Kelly who applies for a job in real estate), and the other about Dianne, married with two sons, who is successfully employed in a male dominated trade. In this frank and informative investigation, the issues taken into account are gender stereotyping, influences and expectations of peer groups, parents and boyfriends in both rural and city environments and the effect of the “Girls Program” courses currently being taught in Australian High Schools.

results.title: The Three robbers
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Tomi Ungerer, this animated tale is about three fierce robbers who terrify the countryside until they meet a little girl named Tiffany. Under Tiffany’s golden charm the robbers turn their gold to good use and all ends happily in this droll tale heightened by bold colourful illustrations. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Three musketeers. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”
An edited version of the 1921 silent film version of the Dumas novel starring Douglas Fairbanks in the role of D’Artagnan, with added commentary. A cloak-and-dagger adventure romance with sequences of lively duels, chases and acrobatics, and the drama of court intrigue, illustrating the silent action film at its best, adaptation of a popular novel to the screen, and the work of Fairbanks.

results.title: The Three little pigs (K)
results.creator_credit: Jan Mack, Paul R. Gagne and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: The legendary story of the three pigs and the greedy, scheming wolf comes to glorious “huffing, puffing” life as the wolf tries his best to outsmart the pigs and at last meets his comeuppance. This favourite story features a lively narration by Ian Thompson. Based on the book by Erik Blegvad.

results.title: The Three fools and the foolish woman
results.creator_credit: Donyo Donev, Animated Cartoon Studio and Boyana Film
results.brief_description: In this animated film the three fools are in the company of a representative of the weaker sex. However as far as her brainpower is concerned, the spectator soon realises that she belongs to their category. They court her in the most stupid possible way bearing out the old truth that even the fool’s love is always foolish.
